special.title: Mysteries of the Warp
special.description: The design intent was for these ships to travel without a Navigator. Adopting one of these warp engines is sure to bring the wrath of the Navis Nobilite upon a Rogue Trader. These vessels can only ride the currents of the warp to follow a 'Calculated Jump'. Multiple redundant cogitation systems aid in finding safe passage. However, the systems required for a Navigator to interface with the Warp Engine are not present. No warp assessment is possible, so the dangers of the Immaterium are increased. When using this system, the vessel must make a daily test on *Table: Warp Travel Encounters*

special.title: Static System
special.description: The Klenova Warp Engine is not compatible with a Navigator's Powers or any Components or other systems that modify warp travel.

special.title: Shield of Faith
special.description: The entire hull of the vessel is covered with silver, hand-inscribed hexagramic wards. These reinforce a Geller Field projected from a 50 metre statue of an Imperial Saint, located just fore of the bridge. Any Navigation Tests to pilot the ship through the warp gain a +10 bonus. When rolling on Table Warp Travel Encounters, the GM rolls twice and allows the Navigator to chose which result is applied.

special.title: Tainted Field
special.description: Any Navigation Tests to pilot the ship through the warp gain a +10 bonus. However, subtract -20 from the result of any rolls made on the Warp Travel Encounters table to reflect the increased risk of warp incident using this type of Gellar field.

special.title: Auto-Engagement Routines
special.description: If the ship unexpectedly enters the warp, roll 1d10. On a 3 or higher, the Gellar Field activates automatically, protecting the ship from any warp intrusion that may have taken place.

special.title: Poorly Tuned
special.description: Because the system serves double duty, it is less effective as a Geller Field. The vessel suffers a +5 penalty to all rolls on  *Table: Warp Travel Encounters*.

special.title: Dependent Systems
special.description: If the vessel's void shield is damaged by a Critical Hit, the Geller Field is damaged as well.
